title: Contacting support services
content:
Just received note from my Internet Provider regarding the need to update/check e-mail account settings and not being a computer expert but following their guidance, my present Firefox settings are set to: Connection settings/Configure Proxy Access to the Internet/Use system proxy settings is selected, is this the correct setting? and why is it so difficult in trying to contact Firefox (or is it Mozilla?) what's wrong with giving a simple phone contact number? 

I don't particularly do 'Community' contacts or Twitter or any other of these such sites where you invariably go round in circles/- I want a technical/technician (personal contact) answers!
creator: alib1976

title: Lots of text is suddenly a different font
content: I was browsing a site when suddenly most of the text got almost unreadably small. I was just scrolling and I don't think I had my hand on the keyboard so I don't think I accidentally activated a shortcut. I checked on another site and I noticed it's now a different font than it was before. I tried reloading firefox and my laptop and it didn't change anything. What did I change? My default font setting is lora, which isn't the font things have changed to
creator: ntpk

title: Youtube music is very muffled and quiet
content:
Greetings, Lately at v104 onwards the Youtube video sound is muffled, I've tried several solutions that are frequently the source of issue like hardware issue(tried a pair of brand new headphones), volume mixer is at the same level of system and everything else other than Firefox sounds reasonably loud, driver reinstallation, removed cache and preference etc.

Last I checked with other browsers for instance Chrome and Edge which are Chromium based and compared both with the same videos but they do not have this issue, so I can confidently say this is Firefox's issue. Hopefully this can be solved.

PS: I did saw one of the older bug tracker forum 3 years ago did mention something like force video to run a different encoder that isn't AV01 in about:config , I did not attempt it as I found it uncomfortable to edit and potentially break my browser.
creator: Shuroko

title: Difficult to investigate AV flagging infections from within cache2\entries\
content:
Hi all,

Seeing a few files getting flagged by AV from within the \appdata\...\cache2\entries\ location, trouble is cannot investigate further / quarantine / whitelist, because of the nature of the cached files, rendered as a series of letters/numbers, without extension... they also appear to be auto-deleted before it's possible for AV to interrogate further.

Presuming chances are these are false-positive flags, but would be good to be able to verify this one way or another.

Similar files seem to exist for Firefox users generally, but vast majority are not currently flagged.

Any thoughts/ideas/similar experiences appreciated...
creator: han_nosolo

title: Links in Thunderbird suddenly try to open a new browser window and after first one, can't
content:
As of yessterday, whenever I click on a link in Thunderbird, it opens or tries to open a new browser window. even if Firefox is already open, the first click in an email will open it in a new window (this never happened before). if i click on a second link, for a while nothing happens then i get the message "Firefox is already running, but is not responding. To use Firefox, you must first close the existing Firefox process, restart your device, or use a different profile." i have to close ALL other Firefox windows if i want to click on a second link.

i could not find any way in Thunderbird to change this behaviour, so i tried to see if something in Firefox needed to be changed. i was then very surprised to discover at the top of the Firefox Settings this message: "Your browser is being managed by your organisation." I'm an individual, at home, not an organisation. No organisation could or should be managing my browser settings and I have never seen this before.

i am now going a bit crazy going round in circles trying to solve the original problem and find out what this "managed by your organisation" means & whether that has anything to do with anything. it seems other people have also had this "managed by your organisation" problem, but all the solutions i can find relate to either windows (i'm on linux) or antivirus software (which i'm not using).

i did do some routine updates a couple of days ago so i'm assuming that something in that has changed either thunderbird or firefox, but i cannot for the life of me understand what. any help much appreciated!
creator: helen45

title: Can't access OS authentication when trying to access passwords
content:
I recently moved from Chrome to Firefox. When I use Firefox on Ubuntu 22.04, I can access my passwords freely. However, when I use it on macOS Monterey, it does not work. Page about:logins shows no logins and passwords but only a small little warning bar in the upper corner that says that I need to login with my OS password (see [[[asks for authentication (password, voice, face or fingerprint) when accessing passwords]]]). However, when I click the small "Connexion" button in the notification bar, nothing happens. I have no pop-up/prompt, neither on the system nor on the web page, to allow me input my credentials. I tried after reinstalling Firefox on my Mac but nothing changed.

Do you know how this problem can be fixed? Thank you, and sorry if it is a duplicate.

title: Firefox asks for my Primary Password 3 times
content:
I've been having trouble with the Primary Password on Firefox for years. Sometimes it didn't ask me for it at all, sometimes randomly after half an hour and now since a year I've been having to type it in three times in total, before Firefox let's me do my thing. What's really weird: The second time the pop-up comes up there are already some characters in the password field and I have to delete them to start typing my Primary Password anew. But lately it always takes three times of typing in the password, until the pop up doesn't come up again. That's stealing a lot of my time and I have no idea what's the reason or what's causing it.

Can anybody help out?

I've tried deleting the unresponsive containers and creating new ones, but that doesn't fix the problem. They work great otherwise - I can still open them with my mouse. Is there a fix for this?

title: Fullscreen toolbar dropdown push the webdown
content: When I enter firefox fullscreen and mouseover the top-edge, the dropdown toolbar/tabs will push the whole website down. Is there a way to alter the default behavior of the toolbar/tabs dropdown such that instead of taking up space and push down the website, just overlay the viewing pane and keep the page unchanged?
creator: fromosia

title: Change language of Firefox Accounts emails
content:
When I receive an email from Firefox Accounts (for example when I sign in on a new device), the email is in French instead of English. All other menus and webpages from Mozilla are correctly in English. It's only Accounts emails that have this problem.

There is no language option on the settings page at accounts.firefox.com. My language is set to English on every browser I'm signed in on, and my IP is in an English-speaking region. My email client and devices are set to English as well.

My guess is that a Firefox Accounts setting was changed to French many years ago, and at some point that setting was removed, leaving it stuck in French. Anyone know a way around this?

content: Trying to use ProctorU with Firefox 104.0.2 on Windows 11 Home, and I am getting the following message : "Monitor Count : You may only use 1 monitor during your exam. title: PayPal Pay window pop-up will not load on any merchant site in Firefox browser only
content:
Currently on Firefox 104.0.1, but I updated it trying to fix this problem. I had 98 or something before.

When I am on any merchant site and I choose their pay by PayPal button, a PayPal pop-up window opens, saying I am recognized on this computer, but then it never finishes loading to the payment options. Actually, I see the options there, but they are greyed out and very blurry, so I cannot make them out and select any of them does not work either.

I have deleted cookies multiple times; ensured paypal.com is allowed pop-ups as well as the merchant websites. I upgraded Firefox. I only have one add-on listed, Amazon Assistant, and I had this problem before I installed it. I have tried every solution I can find on line, although all postings are at least a year old or older, but nothing has worked.

I use to be able to get it to finish loading if I closed the pop-up and reopened it and refreshed the merchant page, but that is no longer working.

It worked on Edge. I hate Edge.

Firefox, please help fix this!

title: Can NOT download .zip archives from usual spot on my iMac, I CAN download the images
content:
I frequent Creative Fabrica a lot, I have had a subscription there for well over a year and never had any problem downloading anything, never had so much as a warning about the website. This website is larger than Creative Market. I purchased the ability to download in a subscription there, my payments are all made on time.

Even then, I am trying to download free "daily gifts" (fonts & graphics), and this is the first time I have tried on my iMac, but FireFox does nothing, and I cannot download the .zip archive, even though I can download the image files.

I have been downloading from elsewhere across the internet just fine. I usually use FireFox because I like it better than Safari (and a lot more than Chrome or Chrome Edge), until this issue.

So, what's the deal?

I heard about restarting in safe mode, but have no idea how, I always have such an issue getting FireFox to restart for updates, already (and why doesn't it offer the button to do just that?).

title: Firefox closes/crashes when scrolling up with scrollbar
content:
I'm repeatedly having an issue where if I use the scroll bar to scroll up quickly my firefox closes, but it doesn't get reported as a crash. If I immediately try to open firefox again it tells me the old one is still running but not responding so I have to click close to open a new session. This has been happening for weeks now.

I considered that maybe there's some kind of interaction with the exit button since it is above the scroll bar and this only happens when I try to scroll up fast and far, but I've not been able to recreate this issue manually, releasing right click doesn't close the browser even if I hover over the x so I have no explanation on why this happens.

Please help, thanks.
creator: vash854
